column4: how many packages are there in ubuntu and what is a site that can tell me this number?
Uh... a lot. Many thousand
I understand this, freebsd has 22k in ports and tells this.
Hm, let me check. apt may give that info
probably wont
Uh... why not? it has a cache file with the entire list
ok sorry, i meant it might but that wont help me if its not on a website.
well, at least of all the ones in the repos you have enabled
Uh... why?
what are you trying to do?
creating a report.
i need hardcore statistics.
Well, cite it as being from apt in Ubuntu 10.10. Anyone who actually cares can look it up
ok how many are there?
thats a piss poor way to cite but meh im not a stickler
So, incase you missed that - 35013 for my system with Universe/multiverse and some other bits enabled
:/ thats not accurate.
thanks anyways.
Uh... how is it not accurate? I mean... it's going to vary based on the version used, the repos enabled and such
Best you could get is a per-repo/version table... But even that's subject to change
yeah your pull of wc -l could mean that the description took 2 lines or more
Doesn't work that way. Pipe it through less witrh a wider console; they all are on one line excluding wordwrap
and it doesn't count that.
